intro: Sphaerostigma tortum, commonly known as the twisted sphaerostigma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant produces capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
